title: CaughtUp LLC
paragraphs: This startup is designed to motivate us to dive into new projects in the pursuit of knowledge and the common good.

title: CaughtUp Web App
paragraphs: One of my main projects for CaughtUp has been the development of our Web App.
Built on Angular with a Firebase backend. I've learned a lot while developing this project.
Currently the goal is to improve the design to improve UI/UX.

title: CaughtUp Event Parser
paragraphs: This project was part of the VT Hacks Hackathon
We wanted to make scheduling easier. The android, iOS, and web application allows users to upload or take a photo with their camera and we create a calendar event for them.

title: This Website
paragraphs: It Started as a project for my Technical Writing class.
I wasn't fully pleased with sticking to a template. So, I decided to re-do the project utilizing new skills such as Angular.

title: Candidates
paragraphs: Wouldn't it be funny if recruiters had to apply for a job candidate? This is a full-stack project designed for my cloud software development class

title: Spot-Block
paragraphs: Senior Capstone Project: My task is to build a front end for a blockhain application. Bid, buy and sell parking spots using smart contracts!

title: Sentanal
paragraphs: A basic Sentiment Analysis project designed to provide insights towards the truthfullness of a news article based on word frequency.
As a team we compared the accuracy of two Naive Bayes Classifiers which we implemented utlizing two different Python libraries, TextBlob and NLTK.

title: Student Housing Guide
paragraphs: The class project was to design a website to help upcoming alumni in search of student housing. To do so, we conducted research on different common choices and created a site aggregate.

title: SheHacks VT Hackathon
paragraphs: Had fun creating a front end for MakeMeGo a small hackathon idea about using geolocation to check-into events and goals.

title: CryptoGuard
paragraphs: An android application that scans APK's in search of vulnerabilities.
This was project for my Security Fundamentals Class.

title: Code Art
paragraphs: Personal project were I experiment with React
More info to come once the project is finished
